specJson.name: brightics.function.recommendation$collaborative_filtering_recommend
specJson.description:
To address some of the limitations of content-based filtering, collaborative filtering uses similarities between users and items simultaneously to provide recommendations. This allows for serendipitous recommendations; that is, collaborative filtering models can recommend an item to user A based on the interests of a similar user B. Furthermore, the embeddings can be learned automatically, without relying on hand-engineering of features.

Reference:
+ <https://developers.google.com/machine-learning/recommendation/collaborative/basics>

params.label: Number of recommendations
params.description: Number of recommendations in the top N list.

params.label: Filter already liked items
params.description: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated.

params.label: Maintain the score of already scored items
params.description: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items.

params.label: Target Users
params.description: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data.

params.label: Number of Neighbors
params.description: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target.

params.label: Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus
params.description: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.

params.label: Normalization of user tendency
params.description: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users.

params.label: Similarity method
params.description: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close).

params.label: Use Centered Mean
params.description: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items.

params.label: Use Weighted Rating
params.description: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users.

params.label: Workers
params.description: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all.

params.label: Use user column name
params.description: Whether to use the user columns name from the input table. If `True`, the columns name will be fixed to 'user_name'.

summary.en: This function provides top N items for each users by using Collaborative Filtering.
summary.ko: Collaborative Filtering 알고리즘 기반 추천 모델을 사용하여 사용자에게 Top-N 항목을 추천합니다.

md.en:
# Collaborative Filtering Recommend This function provides top N items for each users by using Collaborative Filtering. ## Description To address some of the limitations of content-based filtering, collaborative filtering uses similarities between users and items simultaneously to provide recommendations. This allows for serendipitous recommendations; that is, collaborative filtering models can recommend an item to user A based on the interests of a similar user B. Furthermore, the embeddings can be learned automatically, without relying on hand-engineering of features. Reference: + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `User Column`, `Item Column` and `Rating Column` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **User Column***: User column name. 2. **Item Column***: Item column name. 3. **Rating Column***: Rating column name. 4. **Number of recommendations**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. 5. **Filter already liked items.**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items. 7. **Target Users**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. 8. **Number of Neighbors**: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target. 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus. 10. **Based**: Method of recommendation based. 11. **Normalization of user tendency**: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users. 12. **Similarity method**: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close). 13. **Use Centered Mean**: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items. 14. **Use Weighted Rating**: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users. 15. **Group By**: Columns to group by. 16. **Workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. ### Python #### USAGE ``` collaborative_filtering_recommend(table = , user_col = , item_col = , rating_col = , N = , filter = , maintain_already_scored = , targets = , k = , filter_minus = , based = , normalize = , method = , centered = , weighted = , group_by = , workers = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Data in a Table. It must contain `user_col`, `item_col` and `rating_col` used in model training. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**:(Table) Recommendations of Top-N items for each users with the predicted ratings. #### PARAMETER 1. **user_col***: User column name. * Type: *str* 2. **item_col***: Item column name. * Type: *str* 3. **rating_col***: Rating column name. * Type: *str* 4. **N**: Number of recommendations in the top N list. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 5. **filter**: Whether to filter already liked items. If `True`, it does not recommend the items that user already rated. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 6. **maintain_already_scored**: Whether to maintain the score of already scored items. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 7. **targets**: Target users to recommend top N items. Default is all users found in data. * Type: _int_, _float_, _str_ 8. **k**: Number of similar items or users to get predicted rating for target. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 5 (value >= 1) 9. **filter_minus**: Whether to filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: False 10. **based**: Method of recommendation based. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: item ( item | user ) 11. **normalize**: To remove individual rating bias by users who consistently always use lower or higher ratings than other users. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 12. **method**: Estimate how much target user and another user is similar(close). * Type: *str* * Default / Range: cosine ( cosine | pearson | jaccard | adjusted ) 13. **centered**: To make non-rated item neutral, when this is `True`, summation of rating becomes 0 for each items and the rating is 0 for non-rated items. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 14. **weighted**: If `True`, predicted rating for target user is closer to more similar neighbor. If `False`, predicted rating for target user is equally close to k similar users. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 15. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* 16. **workers**: Number of workers. Recommended only if target is all. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]**
In this tutorial workflow, sample_ALSRecommend is used to recommend Top-N items by using Collaborative Filtering algorithm based recommender model. By using Collaborative Filtering Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **User Column***: user 2. **Item Column***: item 3. **Rating Column***: rating 4. **Number of recommendations**: 10 5. **Filter already liked items.**: True 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: True 7. **Target Users**: None 8. **Number of Neighbors**: 5 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: False 10. **Based**: Item Based 11. **Similarity method**: Cosine 12. **Use Centered Mean**: True 13. **Use Weighted Rating**: True 14. **Group By**: None 15. **Workers**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.recommendation import collaborative_filtering_recommend input_table = inputs[0] result = collaborative_filtering_recommend(table=input_table, user_col='user', item_col='item', rating_col='rating', N=10 , filter=True, maintain_already_scored=True, targets=None, k=5, filter_minus=False, based='item', normalize=True, method='cosine', centered=True, weighted=True, group_by=None, workers=1) output = result['out_table'] ```
In this python script, sample_ALSRecommend is used to recommend Top-N items by using tCollaborative Filtering algorithm based recommender model. By using Collaborative Filtering Recommend function, we can get recommendations of Top-N items for users in the data with predicted ratings.
md.kr: # 협업 필터링 추천 이 함수는 협업 필터링(Collaborative Filtering)을 이용해 각 유저별 N개의 아이템을 추천한다. ## Description 협업 필터링은 사용자와 항목 간의 유사성을 동시에 사용하여 추천하여 콘텐츠 기반 필터링의 일부 제한 사항을 해결한다. 이 방식은 우연한 권고를 허용한다. 즉, 협업 필터링 모델은 유사한 사용자 B의 관심사를 바탕으로 사용자 A에게 항목을 추천할 수 있다. 또한 특성의 수제 엔지니어링 없이 임베딩을 자동으로 학습 할 수 있다. Reference: + ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 데이터 테이블. 이 테이블은 모델 학습에 필요한 `User Column`, `Item Column`, `Rating Column`을 포함해야 한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) 예측에 기반한 각 유저별 아이템 추천 결과. #### PARAMETER 1. **User Column***: 유저 컬럼 이름. 2. **Item Column***: 아이템 컬럼 이름. 3. **Rating Column***: 레이팅 컬럼 이름. 4. **Number of recommendations**: 추천할 아이템 개수. 5. **Filter already liked items**: already liked items을 제외할 지 여부. `True`로 설정하면 유저가 이미 레이팅 한 아이템은 추천하지 않음. 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: 이미 점수 매겨진 아이템의 점수를 유지할 지 여부. 7. **Target Users**: 추천할 대상 유저. 초기값은 데이터에 존재하는 모든 유저. 8. **Number of Neighbors**: 추천 예측에 참조할 아이템이나 유저 수. 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: 유사도가 음수인 이웃을 제외할 지 여부. 10. **Based**: 추천 기준. 11. **Normalization of user tendency**: 일관성 있게 낮거나 높은 평가를 하는 유저의 편향을 제거할 지 여부. 12. **Similarity method**: 타겟 유저와 다른 유저가 얼마나 유사한지 추정. 13. **Use Centered Mean**: 평가되지 않은 아이템을 정규화 함. 이 값이 `True`이면 레이팅의 총 값을 0으로 만들고, 평가되지 않은 아이템은 레이팅을 0으로 만듦. 14. **Use Weighted Rating**: `True`로 설정하면 타겟유저에 추천이 유사한 이웃과 비슷함. 'False'로 설정하면 타겟유저에 대한 추천이 유사한 k 유저와 비슷함. 15. **Group By**: 그룹화 대상 컬럼. 16. **Workers**: 워커의 수. 타겟이 전체일 때만 사용 추천. ### Python #### USAGE ``` collaborative_filtering_recommend(table = , user_col = , item_col = , rating_col = , N = , filter = , maintain_already_scored = , targets = , k = , filter_minus = , based = , normalize = , method = , centered = , weighted = , group_by = , workers = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 데이터 테이블. 이 테이블은 모델 학습에 필요한 `User Column`, `Item Column`, `Rating Column`을 포함해야 한다. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**:(Table) 예측에 기반한 각 유저별 가장 좋은 N개의 아이템 추천 결과. #### PARAMETER 1. **user_col***: 유저 컬럼 이름. * Type: *str* 2. **item_col***: 아이템 컬럼 이름. * Type: *str* 3. **rating_col***: 레이팅 컬럼 이름. * Type: *str* 4. **N**: 가장 좋은 N 리스트에서 추천 개수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 10 (value >= 1) 5. **filter**: already liked items을 제외할 지 여부. `True`로 설정하면 유저가 이미 레이팅 한 아이템은 추천하지 않음. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 6. **maintain_already_scored**: 이미 점수 매겨진 아이템의 점수를 유지할 지 여부. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 7. **targets**: 추천할 대상 유저. 초기값은 데이터에 존재하는 모든 유저. * Type: _int_, _float_, _str_ 8. **k**: 추천 예측에 참조할 아이템이나 유저 수. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 5 (value >= 1) 9. **filter_minus**: 유사도가 음수인 이웃을 제외할 지 여부. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: False 10. **based**: 추천 기준. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: item ( item | user ) 11. **normalize**: 일관성 있게 낮거나 높은 평가를 하는 유저의 편향을 제거할 지 여부. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 12. **method**: 타겟 유저와 다른 유저가 얼마나 유사한지 추정. * Type: *str* * Default / Range: cosine ( cosine | pearson | jaccard | adjusted ) 13. **centered**: 평가되지 않은 아이템을 정규화 함. 이 값이 `True`이면 레이팅의 총 값을 0으로 만들고, 평가되지 않은 아이템은 레이팅을 0으로 만듦. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 14. **weighted**: `True`로 설정하면 타겟유저에 추천이 유사한 이웃과 비슷함. `False`로 설정하면 타겟유저에 대한 추천이 유사한 k 유저와 비슷함. * Type: *bool* * Default / Range: True 15. **group_by**: 그룹화 대상 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* 16. **workers**: 워커의 수. 타겟이 전체일 때만 사용 추천. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** 이 예제는 collaborative_filtering_recommend함수를 이용해서 sample_ALSRecommend 데이터의 각 유저에 대해서 N개의 아이템을 레이팅과 함께 추천한다. Collaborative Filtering Recommend 함수를 사용하여 예측된 평점이 있는 데이터에서 사용자에 대한 Top-N 항목의 추천을 얻을 수 있다. 함수에 사용되는 파라미터 설정은 다음과 같다. ++Parameters++ 1. **User Column***: user 2. **Item Column***: item 3. **Rating Column***: rating 4. **Number of recommendations**: 10 5. **Filter already liked items**: True 6. **Maintain the score of already scored items.**: True 7. **Target Users**: None 8. **Number of Neighbors**: 5 9. **Filter Neighbors whose similarity is minus.**: False 10. **Based**: Item Based 11. **Similarity method**: Cosine 12. **Use Centered Mean**: True 13. **Use Weighted Rating**: True 14. **Group By**: None 15. **Workers**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.recommendation import collaborative_filtering_recommend input_table = inputs[0] result = collaborative_filtering_recommend(table=input_table, user_col='user', item_col='item', rating_col='rating', N=10 , filter=True, maintain_already_scored=True, targets=None, k=5, filter_minus=False, based='item', normalize=True, method='cosine', centered=True, weighted=True, group_by=None, workers=1) output = result['out_table'] ``` 이 예제는 collaborative_filtering_recommend함수를 이용해서 sample_ALSRecommend 데이터의 각 유저에 대해서 N개의 아이템을 레이팅과 함께 추천한다. Collaborative Filtering Recommend 함수를 사용하여 예측된 평점이 있는 데이터에서 사용자에 대한 Top-N 항목의 추천을 얻을 수 있다. 사용된 파라미터는 아래와 같다.
